title: Litepage
heading: A minimalist, zero dependency static site generator
subheading: Litepage is an open source lightweight library to help build your static sites, written in Go. Designed to simplify the web.

taglines.text: Works with any static site hosting provider

snippetsSubheading: Build static sites the way you want, while keeping your stack lean.

snippets.heading: Declaratively create your pages
snippets.description: Pass a relative file path to create your pages.  Work with the standard io.Writer interface to support any templating library.

snippets.heading: Minimal folder structure
snippets.description: Put all your static assets in your public folder. Your finished site will be placed in your dist folder.
snippets.snippet:
my-cool-site
└── public
  ├── favicon.ico
  ├── logo.svg
  └── styles.css
└── dist

snippets.heading: Tiny API surface
snippets.description: No deep dives required. Only four methods to work with to create your next project.

snippets.heading: Sitemap out of the box
snippets.description: Get a basic sitemap.xml of all your pages by default, out of the box. Anything to get that extra SEO boost when getting your new site out there on the web.
